content: The red ape can cast spell AOE silence? Even the slow spell is also AOE by the red ape? Is it a bug?

IT'S BACK! I love games that make you feel like you're on a real journey; that make the miles you travel feel like a proper epic travelling distance. Half Life 2 did it, Final Fantasy X did it, and ToI does it too. Although the travelling can be quite mundane - tapping on flora and fauna - and the way the game is programmed (layering image files) makes it unnecessarily large and slow, it's still addictive and entertaining. It has a certain feeling of despair about it, and I like that.
replyContent: Thanks Mataeus! -Chad

replyContent: No, I don't think Google allows this. Each version has it's own product keys and product skus. There might be a way around it. but just buy it and I'll refund you order. just email me the order number. thanks chad

content: Suffers from the same insane difficulty spike out of nowhere as the first game did. The moment you get your 3rd party member, suddenly the fights become crazy. Even if you rest all the time, you'll get these 2 vultures that devour half of your party's hp just by casting 1 poison debuff, then shred you to pieces. Again, it's very obvious the devs want you to spend real money on microtransactions.  Another problem is the writing. It's much weaker than in the first game. In the first game, you would get to know the characters, discover their background, their past, and in general they were interesting characters. The dialog was generally what I'd rate 4 stars.  However, in this game, the writers decided all you ever need to know about the characters is that Kepri is female. Not even 2 hours into the game and I already counted 10x more gender references than in the entirety of the first game. Hammering gender in is not enough to write a good character. This is why I've given it 1 star less than the first game.  Also, the performance is very poor even on good devices. I don't think my Nokia 6.1 is a low spec device, but the game seems to be running at around 15 fps.  Skip this one.

I'll keep even after win because you can always replay, an I'll try the 
others, its easy and adventures travel... InshÅÄllãh wonderful wonderful 
wonderful creation game,

I suppose some of your men would take offense to taking the role of a scantily clad female being in charge. Send me an email if you want to discuss.  -Thanks Chad

content: I don't get it. The game looks promising and interesting. I doubt that all these positive reviews are fake. But I can't leave one, because the game graphics lags soooo much on my device - Nexus 5x, that generally has great performance. The game has almost static graphics with very few simple animations, but they are so crappy that it's unplayable. I tried the caching and performance option and it was the same. Am I missing something?
replyContent:
Hi Ivan,

EP2 is probably not the best way to start the series. Check out Fallen Knight or Destinies first. Buy them and I will refund your orders, just send me an email.

content: Wow, i've been hooked since EP1. Done both good and evil ending, and now playing EP2, and from the reviews i'm sure i'll have good time. Good job developer!

content: This game majorly disappointed me after the first game set such high standards for me personally. While the game itself is a good game it does fall short of first game. Feels like a cheap DLC. This game now has micro-transactions, before hand you would be able to play these Episodes without feeling any pressure at all to pay real life money for a game you completely purchased for. Does offer branching choices but seem limited and as if they would end up having the same outcomes! Couldn't be bothered to replay as it seems combat difficulty spikes out of nowhere to encourage you to pay real life money. I have nothing against supporting hard working developers, but design here surely encourages you to buy gear or you can just get defeated in combat by an enemy way out of your league, as to no fault of your own because of this difficulty spike, ( coming from a experienced old-school RPG player) about 4 or 5 times and wait for the game to naturally weaken it's NPC's so the battles become actually possible.
replyContent: Hi Jose, sorry we let you down, we didn't intend to do anything you suggest. Make sure heroes are always rested, high morale, no wounds, have multiple heals, have a caster with dispel so you can wake stunned, slept,  or poisoned  heroes. Give all your front line Coute De Grace and your archer Head Shot! Email me for more I ran out of space. -Chad

content: I really enjoy the game series but personally I found myself preferring the first one. This one doesnt seem to have much equipment like the first one (if you exclude magic equipments) as it has been the same so far in every city, while in the 1st game equipment was different in every city.  Also this game seems to have slowed down leveling, not sure if its just me or what haha.  I still love the game but I think it's not as good as the first...    also i cant seem to beat the 4 djinn :(
replyContent: Thanks Jiyoung! Did you try the silence spell? -Chad

content: Perfect game. The paid content is definietly cheaper than it could, which makes me actually want to spend those 40 pln and stay with a set of armors and weapons for whole game. Love it. Though if there was option to upload saves on cloud and restore them later, it would be even greater. Was halfway on two devices (not at the same time) and lost saves on both, and having the perspective of starting since the very beginning AGAIN is kinda tiring.
replyContent:
1. On old device Download ES File Explorer, Search for "savedgames", Share the files off. 
2. On new device download the files to the "savedgames" directory.

Email littlekillerz@gmail.com for questions....

content: Same problems as its predecessor. Engaging story, shoddy combat. EDIT: Developers got back to me, more control over combat A.I than I realized. Some default actions should still be tweaked, characters make strange decisions unless micromanaged. Main problem remains- no way to flee unwinnable battles. Five times I had to quit because I ran into a group of angels 3-4 times stronger than my party and I got stomped. 3.5 overall- hopefully pt 3 has an escape option
replyContent:
Hi Joseph,

Many people have requested the ability to run from a battle. The problem we have is that all battles are set in a narrative. We would have to write in an escape option for every battle and sometimes fleeing just doesn't make sense in the current narrative.  

Thanks,
Chad

content: This is better then the first in my opinion. It is an epic game and combat seems alot easier. Again everything I love about a role playing game. replyContent:
Thanks Matty!  The new skills are in the "purchase" menu. They came over from Ep3. FYI Ep2 has only netted 8K dollars, 1/2 of what I paid the writers to write it, meaning me and the artist have been paid 0. So that's why they are not free. On a good note Ep3 made more in one month than Ep2 did in a year and 1/2.

-Chad

content: Managed to complete it within 9 months of game time, and was able to beat the final boss at level 8. I was hoping the game would go on. I also didn't feel attached to the characters in the same way. They felt quite shallow and samey. I shall try the third game, as I hear you can continue playing after the main quest has finished.

TOI is a great game in many respects but the final showdowns are the most tedious exercises ever.  This installment featured wave after wave of generic bad guys.  By round 3 I had gotten bored and was letting the AI do all the work.  By round 5 I was wondering if the game would ever end.  Finally the boss and then the boss turns into another boss and I was thinking "seriously"?  Then you have YET ANOTHER BOSS and by that point I switched off the game and assumed they lived happily ever after.
replyContent:
Hi T,

I can see why that would be tedious. I'm going to resissue EP2 soon and I will address this issue. In the meantime try Ep3 it has no end so no climatic endings either.

Thanks,
Chad

content: This one... Not so much. I really like the party members in the first one, but I'm finding myself not caring about the characters in this one at all, except the main character. I was going to give it 2 stars, but I'll throw in a third because it's not a bad game at all, I just find that the characters don't have as much depth as the first game.
I have hundreds of hours of play time in the first two episodes of this, and I can't wait for the new material. It's been a decade since I spent this much time on a game. Thanks.

content: Edit: it may have double the equipment, but by end game, its all the same best stuff.  My end game party is identical to my end game party in the first game. New trail types are cool at first, just for aesthetics, but arent really any different. The story is much longer, yes, I just didnt enjoy it as much.  I do have to give you the replayable end game.  That was a nice touch. I guess what I really wanted to see was more dungeons, higher max level, and some epic new gear.  Good game; i liked the 1st better.
replyContent:
Edit:Thanks for the update! Ep3 is going to be the definitive Tales experience.

Thanks for the review. Please note Ep2 has...

1) Double the equipment types
2) Double the bestiary
3) Double the trail types
4) Double the story content
5) A more complicated story
6) The entire second half of the game can be played twice

content: It builds upon the first episode with more to be discovered. I particularly enjoyed the first revenge sequence, and the sense of exploration that came afterwards! I would have liked to see more dungeons and more skills, but it still plays amazingly without it. I also hope the level cap will be raised since enemies seem tto scale with you. I can't wait for part 3!
replyContent: Thanks Chris! Ep3 is something special indeed! Tell you what, send us an email to littlekillerz@gmail.com and I can get you in on the beta.

content: Wheres ep3? I'm excited!
replyContent: Mark send us an email to littlekillerz@gmail.com and I can get you in on the beta.

content: Not as good as fallen Knight; also the language gets a little obscene and kinda gross at times and there is too much verbiage, I'd like to see shorter conversation and then a lot of it didn't lead anywhere.

I had so much fun with Ep1, playing good then evil, so I did the same on this one. I have to say that, in the beginning at least, playing evil is MUCH easier. However, playing good has it's on rewards and the game plays well with both, or to switch mid-stream. My only big complaint is the incredibly long story at the beginning. I didn't mind the first couple times, but after that I seriously wanted a way to skip it. I hear rumors of an Ep3. Just based on these two, it'll be an automatic buy.
Great games. Amazing game. Love this game.
If you loved the first one you'll love this one! Also any word on a sequel yet?
replyContent:
Hi Jake,

Thanks for the nice review. Ep3 will launch sometime in June!

Thanks,
Chad

content: Great mix of Oregon Trail and RPG. The only thing that I would add is an Endless mode. cannot wait to play episode 2 hope he keeps going and makes more.

Because of the difficulty level calibration, at the beginning it's not so simple to proceed but if you endure enough the game will become really interesting. I hope there will be more episodes that I will buy for sure ;)

Hi Fabio,

Thanks for the review. Please email us and I can tweak some encounters and spell durations. Also take note, some encounters are not meant for you to beat at low level, like the traveling Djinn and the Dragon. Also EP2 has many more spell casters so the silence spell is important if you want to defeat them easily.

Thanks,
Chad

content: Didn't play ToI:F/K first 'cause I didn't realize this was more like a slightly related next generation  sequel to Tol:F/K, so doubt I go back to play the prequel this year because I enjoyed so much the aps-journeys/adventures through the main protagonist of ToI:BtIW. content: This is one of the few good single-player RPGs I've found for Android.  I got the first episode for free from Amazon and enjoyed it so much I bought it on the app store anyway, at the same time I got this one.  My biggest complaint is just that there's no way to skip the cut scenes and tutorials when you're replaying.  It was mildly irritating in the original, but in this one the start drags on so long that it really discourages me from going through it again.
Still a good game,  but the storyline and writing are much better in the other episode Fallen Knight.
I love this game, but this is definitely one of the hardest RPGs I've ever played. Frequent saving is a must.
I couldn't play past the first couple of towns because while the game mechanics are similar to the original's, the story is awful - at least in the beginning.
Best rpg on android
I absolutely love the storytelling and amount of content!

Best game I've played in ages. Good value for money too, tired of buying android games that you complete in like 4 hours. I usually only play a game once so I took my time with this one and managed to get a good 40 hours or so out of it... :) kept me hooked, hoping a sequel comes out soon or I can find a similar game to this.
replyContent:
Hi Paul,

Thanks for the nice review. Episode 3 is in the works! Its a more opened sandbox experience, you make your own character and have 12 party members you can meet to join your party. You also form your own alliances with the kingdoms and the guilds. It's more about side quests then saving the world.

Thanks,
Chad

content: This is my 3rd try at a play through. The game play and mechanics are good but you really need a better writer as the story and dialogue are just plain bad. So much so that I fast click through it and read nothing so I can get to the game play its self more quickly.
Excellent.....I thought it was even better than the first one. Please make more!

content: Great game with mechanics well set up for mobile. The pacing and balance aren't perfect, on my first playthrough I found it  frustrating that I could barely pay for healing let alone skill upgrades while my characters level rocketed up, leaving my party underpowered and regularly restarting fights. After playing through the original I came back and this time found it quite easy, it seems early decisions can make or break your game. I still couldn't put it down for weeks. Highly recommended, thanks dev!
I enjoyed the game. The level of difficulty is reasonable. I would recommend it for people that like this type of game.

Great game story, and awesome admins that are extremely active and helpful. A must have for any rpg fan.                                Ps: A delete all saved games feature in the options would be wonderful.
replyContent:
Hi Tommy,

Thanks for the review! Couple things. Change the number of autosaves the game keeps. Also you can download ES File Explorer to delete your manual saves in mass. Email us if you need help.

Thanks,
Chad

content: Having played fallen knight, this was a sweet game. Story is good, and it was nice seeing previous characters from fallen knight. Mechanics are the same, and it definitely helped knowing effective moves before starting the game, though some battles literally can never be won unless you spend all your points into cc
I'm having a blast. Tweaks to lvls would be something to think about
Great sequel to the original n worth any money u pay brilliant little rpg

Most things better than part 1. Two caveats- there are a few areas where difficulty spikes can create a blockage, try to keep your saves current. Also it seems that most of what happens in game 1's epilogue is glossed over by the time this one starts. Otherwise many fixes to the base engine, more variety in encounters and side quests, overall an interesting story that keeps going several times past when a typical game would have ended. TOI are mobile tour de forces.
Can't load game after game update?
replyContent:
Hi Wong,

Can you please email us at littlekillerz@gmail.com.

Thanks, 
Chad

content: Great RPG
We need a part 3.  Best RPG on android by far.  Keep up the good work.

I actually enjoy the game very much so... but please please please fix the balance of the enemies... you  guys allow them to dodge far to often and my players barely ever dodge... Also make magic miss sometimes... It's pretty unfair to have a djinn, dragon, and mage enemy killing you before you even move... the fighting balance is sooooo off that it's making the game almost unbearable at some points.. and don't give me that start over bit... i shouldn't have to restarts a fight 100 times to win
replyContent:
Hi Alex,

I admit ep2 is harder than ep1. But you are getting caught up on a couple special battles. The Circle of Djinns, they are a recurring challenge you are meant to lose at low level and win at high level. The dragon between Vasena and Tortha you are not supposed to win it when you first encounter it. Hint get SILENCE spell.

Chad

content: I've been looking for a RPG on Android and glad I downloaded Tales of Illyria. The developer is very responsive, the story is great (LOVE the Codex) and if you play it smart there are only a few impossible battles requiring restarts. I wish one day the developer will put more features in future games such as picking races and allowing guild affiliations with special advancement. Also, enemy "hunting" areas would be great so we could just fight and grind up the levels easier. I like that the enemies in different areas have different levels instead of all enemies leveling up with your character. Higher level attainment would also be great. Buy this game, I've paid 60 times for games less addicting and fun!

I had I slight problem with the game so I emailed littlekillerz and they responded and had me up and going in a matter of hours! They even double checked with me to make sure the problem was resolved. Absolutely no complaints.
replyContent:
Hi Cole,

They use the exact same code, installer, servers and packages. Send me an email and I'll tell you how to point Ep2 to the Ep1 install. I'll have you up in five minutes and you'll save room on your phone. 

Thanks, 
Chad

content: A great sequel to Fallen Knight, showing life behind the often mentioned Iron Wall.  After a shocking (and brutal) start, and what seems like a limited map, things really open up.  As with the first game there are different choices you can make that could change the outcome.  There is one choice after the first big boss battle that makes a big difference so everyone should play through at least twice (but you may find yourself playing more than that to try out different skills or get side quests).

I enjoyed the fallen knight but as others said I found the enemy difficulty scales up faster than my party level in this game. I win several fights between towns to encounter an unavoidable and unwinnable battle near the end of my journey forcing me to reload back 20 to 30 mins of gameplay and lose all the XP and loot I got on the way. Only buy this game if you're prepared to spend lots of time in trial and error and don't mind losing significant progress when you hit dead ends.
replyContent:
Hi Owen,

Sorry about the difficulty.

Try lowering the difficulty
Each time you try a battle it gets easier
Be sure to level
Keep morale high
Camp after battles 
Heal ailments in temples
Stay in taverns and get drinks
Keep a stock of all provisions
Max out heal
Dont depend only on AI

Read the Strategy guide
http://tinyurl.com/mms4fno

Thanks
Chad

content: Lots of fun.   The game is clever and engaging.   I recommend the hard setting.  The game challenging, but definitely doable.
replyContent:
Hi Peter,

Please contact us for a refund. Also what device do you have? This sounds like a very weird bug related to your device. If what you described was true for all devices we would have nothing but one star reviews.

Thanks,
Chad

content: Great entry in one of Android's best RPG series. The core gameplay remains unchanged for the most part and is still just as enjoyable, but the storyline, bestiary and items have grown. Hope to see more from these guys.
Well Done
Very good!

A great sequel to the original.  Very entertaining. Nice story and plot with some great little Easter eggs in the dialog.  Once again micro transaction free, I hate pay to win games.  This is a much better model.  Can't wait for the third in the trilogy.
Yes it is.

This game, while a sequel, does not require playing its predecessor fallen knight--but you should!  High quality, engaging, entertaining, and backed by superb customer service...just get it!  Coming from an RPG fiend,  Tales of Illyria is something special
Great RPG. Huge world to explore and very elaborate story line.

Game can be fun but is more often just frustrating. Pace is too fast, enemies power up quickly, party does not, took less then 2 hours to face an opponent that dealt 50 damage when my HP was 17. also enemy AI is very good, own party AI absolutely retarded. Will often waste a turn to walk right into death knowing that HP is at critical rather than healing. Bad conditions far out weigh good ones which caused me to constantly have no money to buy weapons or heal wounds or buy new skills. Wounds would be healed by resting in most games. here wounds are fixed separately with gold but HP is not restored...pay gold again to restore HP. Would then set out and 10 seconds into journey an event would cause the same old ailment that I can't fix for days unless I head back right back to the city. BTW all this is on normal difficulty. People and animals are constantly robbing or hurting you outside of battle in events so that when you reach an actual battle you are at a disadvantage.  Edit* didn't realize that the level menu button is where you allocate stat points. Maybe rename it to stat points? I basically played end game with level 1 stat characters.
replyContent:
Hi J,

Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. A couple notes....

1. Heroes and enemies use the same AI.
2. Did you camp after battle? You can heal up to 80% hitpoints and many ailments by camping.
3. I'll take a look at the ratio of good an bad events.
4. Contact us for a refund. Or if you would like some hints.

Thanks,
Chad

content: After all the positive reviews and scores on play I thought I would give this a try, 1hr later I uninstalled. The game is simple at best, character design very bad in fact their are only really two in the entire game , a male and female but with different hair and outfits. Gameplay is slow and a grind and not fun, text seems very rushed , I just don't feel like its a game I can play to enjoy.
replyContent:
Hi Malachai,

Did you get past the intro and on to the trail?  It picks up a lot after that. Please send me an email and I can give you  a refund.

Thanks,
Chad

content: Simultaneously innovative and old school, I can't stop playing this superb RPG!!
Best RPG Series for Android.  Hands Down.
Nice story and confusing battle system.

The TOI series is great!  The story is well written, options are very diverse and party has growth. Other than the graphics not being 10/10, this game is awesome. If you like rpgs and want a great story, this is for you.

Bought both fallen knight & beyond the iron wall but I end up received a "insufficient storage" crap before it attempt to installing.  Internal storage 3.4gb,  sd card 51gb.  Samsung galaxy note 10.1 (gt-n8000) android version 4.1.2
replyContent:
Hi Sheau,

Send us an email and we can get you a refund for your trouble. Also I can help you install if you are still interested. Do you have a virus program installed or something that's preventing the app from accessing storage?

Thanks,
Chad

content: Easily the best RPG game on app store hands down, couldn't put it down, story was awesome and adventurous with fantastic side quests, combat was fun, tactical, and rewarding, enjoyed each character and everyone you meet along the way, basically everything that made me love the first one was there and then some. The only problem I had with the game was how unsuccessful with skills I was no matter what amount of collective skill I had between me and my party, other then that superb job, keep up the good work.
replyContent:
Ryel,

Thanks for the very nice review! Please email us at littlekillerz@gmail.com and maybe we can give you some hints.

Chad

content: Bigger than first, a little bit less forgiving than the first and definitely more challenging in terms of puzzles. I do think that they went overboard in nerfing some skills that were too powerful in the first game. Can't wait for the 3rd installment.
This and the predecessor are amongst the best games I've played on mobile.  Losing a lot of sleep lately.
Good storyline,  strategic turn based combat and a free roaming quest system make this game a gem to play. If advancement of some of the side quests were not so vague then 5* all the way.
Awesome game Customer service is top notch also. Had some very minor issues and the developer resonded instantly with questions on how I could play this great game . impressive

This is honestly one of the best Android rpgs I've played. Using the Oregon Trail-style exploration make this both unique and nostalgic at the same time. The story is decent. It's not on the level of epics like Final Fantasy or Dragon Age, but it has some good moments and fun character interactions. I would honestly give it 5 stars if not for the awful balancing issues. During the course of 5 minutes, it's quite common to fight a random battle you barely succeed in winning (nothing wrong there), followed immediately by a battle you win with not rouble whatsoever (again, not a problem), followed immediately with a battle against foes who decimate your party without your team making a scratch(not cool at all). You can restart any battle to try different tactics, but in far too many cases, these random battles are impossible to win, forcing you to reload your last save file and losing up to a half hour of gameplay if you're not diligent in saving. Saving often is a necessity.  Edit-The above is actually for the first game. This game earned an extra star (from 3-4) as it improves the balancing a lot. It still can be frustrating at times, but not nearly as often.
I hope there will be more future content like this one.
I know this will be good!
I've never played a game quite like this one. very entertaining

Not *quite* as good as the 1st game, but MUCH better after the most recent balancing. The art for the various Djinn is great. However, after "saving" the djinn from poison, his ghost hangs around, making training, etc cost as much as it would with an extra person, and his stats show in a misaligned way when traveling.
replyContent:
Hi Rachel,

Did a Djinn stay in your party? This would be a bug. Please email us.

Thanks,
Chad

content: Just started and good so far. Wish the characters didn't all look the same.  Women all have a god awful lazy eye that makes them hard to look at.

Best game srtategic rpg adventire all in one it simple . I can't stop playng. I whsh the game never stop. if the makers oof the game see this message do a nother plz I can't wait for another one plz..

content: I enjoyed the first episode immensely and this delivers more of the same.  Combat is very tough initially, and I still can't get past those blood apes! Also finding it hard to earn money...loot drops from enemies are pretty stingy (i.e. armour, weapons).  There appears to have been a number of updates since release so can't fault developer for support, well worth the cost so far!

Bought this based on how much I liked the first episode.  Same gameplay engine, but the characters and story seem more polished and rounded out.  They added alot of minor tweaks, learning from the first episode, and those little things make the game that much more enjoyable. Can't wait for the next one!

Loved the game!! Alot of great events... but I found that the events that need higher persuasion/stealth tend to happen early in the game... as well I have to comment on the blood apes... way too strong for how small your party is... and combined with the small map area, makes it hard to get the experience you need without farming the savanna back and forth for the alchemy/hunting xp. Also needing furs in the desert in winter?? O.o.. Still very much love the game.. bought it asap, and can't wait for more!!
replyContent:
Thanks, Kris.
We are getting some complaints about he blood apes, so those will be slightly nerfed. 
Deserts get very cold at night. Water absorbs heat and regulates temperature. Arid climates therefore fluctuate in temperature.
I will relay the message about persuasion and stealth to the writing team. They will be sacked. jk

content: Well over halfway through now. Great story, very nicely different from Episode 1. Gameplay remains solid, and has been tuned better such that input into combat is necessary, rather than leaving the AI on autopilot now.   One small nitpick: although I definitely like the way you can level Kepri as a fighter or mage, or combination of the two, it is a little annoying how she keeps on trying to advance to the forward rank in battle even if you've only levelled her as a mage.  Edit: Thanks for the reply!  Didn't realise there was that level of granularity in AI configuration.  It would be nice to have to ability to set AI outside of combat through the menus.  Keep up the good work!
replyContent:
Edit: You could also arm Kepri with a bow or give her a combat spell so she has something she can do when she's not buffing, but still remain in the back rank.

Andrew,

Thanks for the nice review! Please set Kepri's AI to buff only, or tell her to ignore her melee combat skills. Send us an email if you want to discuss. 

Thanks,
Chad

content: There are too many unbalanced encounters, such as the blood apes which are a mandatory fight early in the game. Having to replay a fight 20 times doesn't make a game challenging, just pointless. Also several bugs that allow for infinite exp.
replyContent:
Hi Marty,

I can nerf the blood apes. Also which bug are you speaking of to allow "infinite exp"? Please send us an email. 

Thanks,
Chad

content: Everything seems to have taken a tremendous leap in the wrong direction. Whatever could even be vaguely interpreted as an improvement is immediately ruined by several random, unnecessary, game breaking bugs. And I could pardon that if it weren't coupled with the fact the all of the potential for the plot and setting of this game is squandered by the absolutely horiffic writing. Save your cash, or pirate it. It's not worth dropping  your cash for a mediocre product. The first game is better.
replyContent:
Hi Raphael,

Sorry we let you down. Perhaps its because you played the enhanced version of EP1 which included much of what we improved while developing EP2. This game was developed by the exact same writing team . Version 3.09 fixes all known bugs. Please contact us for a full refund and please do not advice people to pirate.

Thanks,
Chad

content: The last game was great but this one blows it out of the water! I had no idea how much stepping up Little Killerz still intended to do. Well worth what I paid for it, well done.

Alot of fun with the game play style.. i bought thr game right away after finished ep1 however ep 2 still got soem bug that need to be fixed. Espexially the one that i encountered by myself that an npc joined my team in an event but still remain afterward... until i got the last character... the game crash becuz of that npc still in my party lol. I have to replay from before i got this event duh.. anyway the game still good.
From one of, if not THE hardest working Dev team in RPG mobile games.  So much detail, player choices and grand sweeping adventure.
replyContent: Thanks Dana!

content: F r e a k i n g awesome.
The new story line is refreshingly original, and there are so many twists, turns, options and events that it feels like there's a thousand ways to play this game.
A good story with a good combat system.  What more can you ask for from an RPG.
Great game.  A sequel to part 2, and they didn't disappoint with another A+ game.  By far the best Android developer on the market, with the best games.  I cannot recommend this game highly enough.

I played the first one for 3 days at first then put it away for 2 months, then played again after they updated it and refined it a bit fell in love all over again. Now i hoping that number 2 gives me the same goosebumps i felt when fighting epic battles in the first one and also hoping that i fall in love with another great rpg. Price don't matter if you know its going be a epicly good game ;).
